at0000.1.description: A framework to communicate information that has been captured and curated in anticipation of future need for care.

en.purpose: To record additional composition metadata aligned with IHE-XDS which is not already available from the Reference Model COMPOSITION class.
en.use: Use to add IHE-XDS aligned metadata to a COMPOSITION.context, which along with existing COMPOSITION attributes, allows the composition to be registered in an IHE-XDS environment.

en.purpose: The patient's current status with respect to healthcare funding arrangements.

at0000.1.description: The patient's current status with respect to healthcare funding arrangements.

at0002.1.text: Is the patient in receipt of NHS funded continuing care?
at0002.1.description: The status of the patient's ongoing continuing healthcare funding.

fi.purpose: *To record the responses to an individual- or self-reported questionnaire screening about social issues. (en)
fi.use:
*Use to record the responses to an individual- or self-reported questionnaire screening about social issues.

Common use cases include, but are not limited to:
- Systematic questioning in any consultation; or
- Specific questioning related to screening for social determinants of health, including housing and homelessness, social isolation, employment, education, social supports, gambling, safety and exposure to violence.

A specific question to identify homelessness at the time of recording has been added as it is a ubiquitous issue in so many settings.

In order to record the response at a specific point in time or within an interval of time, use the EVENT RM attribute.

This archetype has been designed to be used as a screening tool or to record simple questionnaire-format data for use in situations such as a disease registry. If the screening process identifies a social issue and it is intended that the details are to be recorded and persisted as part of an ongoing health record, any further specific details about the social issue should be recorded using archetypes specific for the clinical purpose. (en)
fi.misuse: *Not to be used to record persisent details about a social context-related concepts. For example: housing, education, occupation, social supports and social network. Use specific archetypes for this purpose. (en)

nb.purpose: For å registrere responsen i et spørreskjema om sosiale problemer.
nb.use:
*Use to record the responses to an individual- or self-reported questionnaire screening about social issues.

Common use cases include, but are not limited to:
- Systematic questioning in any consultation; or
- Specific questioning related to screening for social determinants of health, including housing and homelessness, social isolation, employment, education, social supports, gambling, safety and exposure to violence.

A specific question to identify homelessness at the time of recording has been added as it is a ubiquitous issue in so many settings.

In order to record the response at a specific point in time or within an interval of time, use the EVENT RM attribute.

This archetype has been designed to be used as a screening tool or to record simple questionnaire-format data for use in situations such as a disease registry. If the screening process identifies a social issue and it is intended that the details are to be recorded and persisted as part of an ongoing health record, any further specific details about the social issue should be recorded using archetypes specific for the clinical purpose. (en)
nb.misuse: Skal ikke brukes til å registrere detaljer om spesifikke sosiale kontekstrelaterte konsepter. For eksempel: bolig, utdanning, yrke, sosial støtte og sosialt nettverk. Bruk spesifikke arketyper for dette formålet.

de.purpose: *To record the responses to a screening questionnaire for medical devices. (en)
de.use:
*Use to record the responses to a screening questionnaire for medical devices.

Common use cases include, but are not limited to:
- Checklist questions about whether the individual uses any devices or aids
- Questionnaires about the usage of specific devices or aids

In order to record the response at a specific point in time or within an interval of time, use the EVENT RM attribute.

This archetype has been designed to be used as a screening tool or to record simple questionnaire-format data. If the screening process identifies the usage of a specific device and it is intended that the details are to be recorded and persisted as part of an ongoing health record, any further specific details about the device should be recorded using the EVALUATION.device_summary archetype. (en)
